subject: AI
title: Step-by-Step Instructions
description: Break complex tasks into numbered steps for better results.

hook.text: You ask the model to 'analyze this dataset and give recommendations.' It gives a vague overview. You rewrite with five numbered steps and get a detailed, structured analysis.

buildup.text: When you break a complex task into explicit steps, the model follows them in order. 'Step 1: Identify the main themes. Step 2: For each theme, list supporting evidenceâ€¦'

discovery.text: Step-by-step prompts force the model to do intermediate work, reducing the chance it skips reasoning and jumps to a shallow conclusion.

twist.text: Too many micro-steps can backfire â€” the model spends tokens on trivial steps and runs out of context for the important ones. Aim for 3â€“7 meaningful steps.

climax.text: If your task needs more than one mental step, write those steps out explicitly. Don't trust the model to infer your process.

punchline.text: If you wouldn't ask a colleague to do it in one breath, don't ask the model to either.

quiz.question: Why do step-by-step prompts improve output quality?
options: They force the model to do intermediate reasoning instead of jumping to conclusions
They make the model run faster
They bypass the model's safety filters
